results.title: Post partum depression
results.brief_description: Two couples discuss their experience with, and feelings about, post natal depressions and the way they were able to overcome the problem with the aid of a post partum counselling group.

results.title: Post-Impressionists
results.creator_credit: George Barford, Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Surveys the aims, influences and techniques of Cezanne, Gauguin, Van Gogh, Seurat, and Toulouse-Lautrec. Indicates how the experiments and work of these artists led to different movements in modern painting.

results.title: Ports of industrial Scandinava
results.brief_description: A journey down the east coast of Sweden by tramp steamer through the Gulf of Bothnia to the Baltic Sea with stops at various ports to unload cargo. It is winter and because the Gulf is not very salty is freezes easily. Lumber products are an important export. The trees are cut chiefly in winter by men who are frequently farmers in summer. Logs are bought to the pulp mills and the process of making wood pulp is shown. Steel and iron products are important exports from a region where iron mines and water power are abundant. Stockholm is the last stop and the home port, and we are shown something of the city, including the home surroundings of the first mate of the ship who goes ashore for a visit to his family.

results.title: Portrait of Zubin Mehta
results.creator_credit: Erik Daarstad, Terry Sanders and Terry Sanders Productions
results.brief_description: The story of Zubin Mehta, a young Indian-born conductor of the Los Angeles Symphony Orchestra and the Metropolitan Opera House Company. Follows the conductor on his daily routine - rehearsals, meetings, performances, and back-stage life - and on his world tour with the orchestra, winding up at his birth place in Bombay. Ends with Ravel’s arrangement of Mussorgsky’s “Pictures at an exhibition”.

results.title: Portrait of an Occultist
results.brief_description: An insight into the religious convictions of a Pagan High Priestess. She stresses that she isn’t a witch, but an occultist, whose belief involves many Gods. Magic used is for the betterment of humanity, and not for evil purposes

results.title: Portrait of a Queen
results.brief_description: A review of the life of HM Queen Elizabeth II. Glimpses of her early childhood, her marriage, the Coronation and other notable events, such as visits to Commonwealth and other countries overseas. The Queen as an individual, in family life. Her constitutional role as Sovereign and Head of the Commonwealth.

results.title: Portrait of a people: impressions of Britain
results.brief_description: This film is a poetic evocation of the history and character of a nation, and the quality of its life today. The visual panorama of British landscape, industrial strength, and social achievement is accompanied by spoken words, based on the thoughts of Britons. It takes the form of a film journey which seeks to convey an understanding of the ways in which people have adapted to the changed imposed by recent development.

results.title: Portrait of a girl
results.brief_description: An experimental film. Uses close up photography and low key lighting to provide an unusual and perhaps cruel look at a familiar and everyday occurrence; the ritual of a girl applying her makeup. We see a series of rather frightening extreme close-ups, and not until the second last shot do we see the girl’s face completely; a shot which is held only long enough to give a tantalising glimpse of her.
